subject: Creativity
title: Electronic Music: When Machines Became Musicians
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Electronic Music: When Machines Became Musicians.

hook.text: In 1970, Kraftwerk built their own electronic instruments and programmed machines to play music. Humans became optional.

buildup.text: The Moog synthesizer (1964) could generate any sound imaginable â€” but it was room-sized, expensive, and required.

discovery.text: When synthesizers became affordable in the early 80s, bedroom producers replaced entire studios.

twist.text: Musicians feared machines would kill creativity. Instead, machines became creativity's most powerful instrument of expression.

climax.text: EDM, techno, house, ambient, synthwave â€” an entire universe of genres exists because someone plugged in a circuit.

punchline.text: Machines didn't replace musicians. They made everyone a musician.

quiz.question: What was the key effect of synthesizers becoming affordable?
options: Bedroom producers could replace entire studios
